com.github.nwillc.funjdbc

Interface DbAccessor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ConnectionProvider
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Migration
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Manager, MigrationBase

    public interface DbAccessor
extends ConnectionProvider
    Interface, with default methods providing JDBC database access functionality.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • dbQuery

        default <T> java.util.stream.Stream<T> dbQuery(Extractor<T> extractor,
                                               java.lang.String sql,
                                               java.lang.Object... args)
                                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Extract results from a SQL query designed to return multiple results. The SQL, and it's optional args are formatted with String.format(String, Object ...) method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type extracted and returned in the stream
        Parameters:
        extractor - The extractor to process the ResultSet with
        sql - The SQL being used
        args - If present, used as arguments in sql = String.format(sql,args)
        Returns:
        a stream of the extracted elements
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the query or an extraction fails

      • stream

        default <T> java.util.stream.Stream<T> stream(Extractor<T> extractor,
                                              java.sql.ResultSet resultSet)
        Given an Extractor and ResultSet return a Stream of results.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type parameter
        Parameters:
        extractor - the extractor
        resultSet - the result set
        Returns:
        the stream

      • dbFind

        default <T> java.util.Optional<T> dbFind(Extractor<T> extractor,
                                         java.lang.String sql,
                                         java.lang.Object... args)
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Extract the result from a SQL query which returns at most one result. The SQL, and it's optional args are formatted with String.format(String, Object ...) method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type extracted and optionally returned
        Parameters:
        extractor - the extractor to extract teh result
        sql - The SQL to execute
        args - If present, used as arguments in sql = String.format(sql,args)
        Returns:
        an Optional of the data
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the query or extraction fails, or if multiple rows returned

      • dbUpdate

        default int dbUpdate(java.lang.String sql,
                     java.lang.Object... args)
              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Execute a SQL update or delete. The SQL, and it's optional args are formatted with String.format(String, Object ...) method.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL.
        args - any optional arguments
        Returns:
        the count of rows updated.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the update fails
